metadata.title: CVE-2017-5597 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
In Wireshark 2.2.0 to 2.2.3 and 2.0.0 to 2.0.9, the DHCPv6 dissector couldgo into a large loop, triggered by packet injection or a malformed capturefile. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-dhcpv6.c by changing adata type to avoid an integer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5597` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
libwireshark8 - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
libwiretap6 - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
libwscodecs1 - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
libwsutil7 - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
tshark - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
wireshark - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
wireshark-common - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
wireshark-gtk - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
wireshark-qt - 2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.6+g32dac6a-2ubuntu0.16.04').
